node.statement: (Wick power regularity under mu) Under the Phi^4_3 measure mu, the renormalized Wick powers converge as distributions: (i) :phi_eps^2:_{C_eps} = phi_eps^2 - C_eps(0) converges mu-a.s. and in L^p(mu) for all p >= 1 to a limit :phi^2: in C^{-1-delta}(T^3) for every delta > 0. (ii) :phi_eps^3:_{C_eps} = phi_eps^3 - 3 C_eps(0) phi_eps converges mu-a.s. and in L^p(mu) for all p >= 1 to a limit :phi^3: in C^{-3/2-delta}(T^3) for every delta > 0. The regularity indices -1-delta and -3/2-delta are sharp up to the delta loss. Proof: For (i), the Besov regularity of :phi^2: follows from the product structure. Since phi in C^{-1/2-delta}, by the paraproduct decomposition of Bony (1981) and the refinement in Gubinelli-Imkeller-Perkowski (2015, Theorem 4.1), the resonant product phi \\circ phi is well-defined provided the sum of regularities exceeds -d = -3, which is satisfied since (-1/2-delta) + (-1/2-delta) = -1-2delta > -3. The Wick subtraction removes the divergent diagonal and the limit :phi^2: belongs to C^{2(-1/2-delta)} = C^{-1-2delta}. Since delta > 0 is arbitrary, we may relabel to get C^{-1-delta} for any delta > 0. For (ii), :phi^3: = :phi^2: \\cdot phi (via the recursive Wick product formula) requires the paracontrolled analysis. The enhanced data (phi, :phi^2:, :phi^3:) is part of the model/modelled distribution in Hairer's framework. In regularity structures (Hairer 2014, Section 10), the symbol Xi^3 has homogeneity 3(-1/2-delta) = -3/2-3delta, and the reconstruction theorem (Theorem 3.10) yields :phi^3: in C^{-3/2-3delta} subset C^{-3/2-delta}. In paracontrolled distributions (GIP 2015, Section 5.2), the iterated commutator estimates give the same regularity. The L^p(mu) convergence for all p >= 1 follows from the uniform moment bounds E_mu[||:phi_eps^k:||_{C^{-k/2-delta}}^p] <= C(p) < infinity established in Mourrat-Weber (2017, Proposition 3.2) and Gubinelli-Hofmanova (2019, Proposition 2.3).
